content.raw:
Hi Louise,

Thanks a lot for your super-responsiveness.  

The problem I alluded to arises when you render simultaneously a simulation on a web client and on a Gazebo desktop simulation.

Every time you bind Light intensity in THREE.js with attenuation in Gazebo/OGRE3D you introduce a discrepancy for directional light behavior between client and server:

- on the client side (scene rendered using THREE.js), the intensity changes because some attenuation factors change and are used in the intensity formula
- on the server side (scene rendered using OGRE3D), the "intensity" doesn't change because a directional light is not affected by attenuation.

Changing diffuse (and/or specular) color is the only way to change what we would call "intensity" of a directional light in a Gazebo-OGRE3D simulation.
